com.stormpath.sdk.hazelcast

Class HazelcastCacheManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stormpath.sdk.hazelcast.HazelcastCacheManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CacheManager

    public class HazelcastCacheManager
extends Object
implements CacheManager
    A CacheManager implementation that manages and returns Cache instances backed by Hazelcast Maps. Each Hazelcast map instance is treated as a 'cache region', and, by default, each region is named after the fully qualified interface name of the resource cached, for example, com.stormpath.sdk.account.Account, com.stormpath.sdk.group.Group. This allows you to define and configure Hazelcast maps based on the name of the type of data being stored, which is often the most common way of configuring data caching policies.

    Usage

    Setting up and configuring a Hazelcast cluster is outside the scope of this SDK and its documentation, but the Hazelcast team provides great Hazelcast Documentation . It is especially important to consult the Hazelcast documentation to understand how to specify Time-To-Live and Time-To-Idle configuration for your Stormpath SDK cache regions, as well as perhaps to enable advanced features like eviction policies and maybe even persistent backup.

    Once your Hazelcast environment is accessible, you should obtain a HazelcastInstance per the Hazelcast documentation. Then you would specify that instance when constructing your Stormpath SDK Client. For example:

     HazelcastInstance hazelcast = getMyHazelcastInstance(); //get or create your Hazelcast instance from somewhere

 CacheManager cacheManager = new HazelcastCacheManager(hazelcast);

 Client client = Clients.builder().setCacheManager(cacheManager).build();

    When the client is constructed, it will then use Hazelcast for all its caching needs.

    HazelcastClient or HazelcastInstance?

    It should be noted that if your application acts as a pure client to a Hazelcast cluster - that is, it is not a peer member of the Hazelcast cluster itself, but only a client of the cluster - that configuring a HazelcastClient instance is likely the preferred type to use in your application code.

    However, note that HazelcastClient implements the HazelcastInstance interface. This means that you can use either a HazelcastClient instance or a server/peer HazelcastInstance runtime instance when creating a HazelcastCacheManager. Either will work fine depending on your application needs. For example, either of these two code samples will work depending on how you choose to access Hazelcast:

     HazelcastInstance hazelcast = getMyHazelcastInstance(); //get or create your Hazelcast instance from somewhere
 CacheManager cacheManager = new HazelcastCacheManager(hazelcast);
 Client stormpathClient = Clients.builder().setCacheManager(cacheManager).build();

    or:

     HazelcastClient hazelcastClient = getMyHazelcastClientInstance(); //get or create your HazelcastClient instance from
 somewhere
 CacheManager cacheManager = new HazelcastCacheManager(hazelcastClient);
 Client stormpathClient = Clients.builder().setCacheManager(cacheManager).build();
    Since:
    1.0.RC3

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HazelcastCacheManager()
      Creates a new HazelcastCacheManager that, after creation, must be configured with a HazelcastInstance via the setHazelcastInstance method.
      HazelcastCacheManager(com.hazelcast.core.HazelcastInstance hazelcastInstance)
      Creates a new HazelcastCacheManager that uses the specified hazelcastInstance to acquire maps for all caching operations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HazelcastCacheManager

        public HazelcastCacheManager()
        Creates a new HazelcastCacheManager that, after creation, must be configured with a HazelcastInstance via the setHazelcastInstance method.

      • HazelcastCacheManager

        public HazelcastCacheManager(com.hazelcast.core.HazelcastInstance hazelcastInstance)
        Creates a new HazelcastCacheManager that uses the specified hazelcastInstance to acquire maps for all caching operations. Because HazelcastClient implements the HazelcastInstance interface, the argument may be a HazelcastClient instance if desired.
        Parameters:
        hazelcastInstance - the HazelcastInstance (or HazeclastClient) used to acquire maps for all caching operations.

    • Method Detail

      • setHazelcastInstance

        Uses the specified hazelcastInstance to acquire maps for all caching operations. Because HazelcastClient implements the HazelcastInstance interface, the argument may be a HazelcastClient instance if desired.
        Parameters:
        hazelcastInstance - the HazelcastInstance (or HazeclastClient) used to acquire maps for all caching operations.

      • getCache

        public <K,V> Cache<K,V> getCache(String name)
        Description copied from interface: CacheManager
        Acquires the cache with the specified name. If a cache does not yet exist with that name, a new one will be created with that name and returned.
        Specified by:
        getCache in interface CacheManager
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the cache to acquire.
        Returns:
        the Cache with the given name
